item.description:
Dice games are controversial.  Often times, these games are believed to be purely luck based and lack the level of choice found in say, strategy games.  In addition, these games often have a strong gambling feel to them, invoking the sense of being a casino right in your own home.  Depending on the type of gamer you are, these traits can either be offputting or be exactly your cup of tea.

For those of you who do enjoy dice games or want to give them another a chance, this event is for you.  :-)  If you want to find others to play the classics with (Yahtzee, Bunco, Farkle, etc.) we will definitely accomodate.  However, in addition we will also try and show off games that challenge the negative stereotypes associated with dice games.  In other words, today will be a afternoon of celebrating games whose primary mechanic is dice rolling.

So if you're on a roll, I hope to see you! :-)

 

----------------------------

This is a  Mini-Meetup. Anyone can sign up, but I would please ask that you  allow new or previously inactive members get a slot if they are on the waiting list since there is limited seating.  Thanks. See this  discussion for more details.

----------------------------

 

Food theme: 

The theme for this event will be "food that rolls".  Please bring a food item to share with the group that fits that theme.  Interpret that however you want, but here are some examples to stimulate your brain:  Jelly roll, oranges, frankfurters, a can of Pringles, etc.  I will try to have also generic, healthy snacks on hand for all diets.

 

About the location:  
This event will be hosted at a private residence, conveniently located at the intersections of Route 1 and Route 95.  If you need directions, just ask.  This is a housing complex, so please do NOT park in any numbered spaces.  There are no animals on the premises.  Look for Unit 901 since Meetup doesn't display addresses correctly! :-(

group.name: The Salem Board Games Meetup Group

item.name: Mini-Meetup: On a Roll
